rComments: Hector's class is very interesting and is a challenge but overall I really did injoy the class. Many of the other students did complain about how Hector only collected one of the two essays but I belive the only reason he collected one was because he wanted to see who the hard workers were.

Professor Perla seems like a really chill professor. He is not only helpful during office hours, but he also makes lectures funny and interesting.  Although he makes us write two essays to collect only one, I definitely took that requirement as a challenge. Open Veins by Eduardo Galeano is a good book, a bit boring, but interesting.

He's very funny and passionate in his lectures. The midterms are a bit challenging (multiple choice) since no study guide is provided but do the essay well and you'll forsure pass them. The readings are long.

Hector was the least organized Professor I have ever had at UCSC. He did not follow his syllabus and it honestly seemed like he forgot he even had one. His tests were horrible, and clearly recycled from years past. They tested on ridiculous tiny minutia that had nothing to do with the "big picture". He seemed friendly, but was an unclear teacher.

I absolutely hated the midterm and final. For the midterm, he made us write 2 essays and he only collected 1. The multiple choice part for both test was terrible, they were all true/false questions. Worst test I've even taken, it didn't prove that I learned anything. The reading were a waste of time. Latino Politics was good though.

Very boring class. If youre not Latino, hard to even understand half the material presented fro the videos and movies because there arent subtitles or nobody who speaks spanish will explain. Lectures were so boring, i hardly showed up and just took the notes independently online (after he would post them to ecommons). Overall, dislike.

Don't pay attention to the person saying that people ignore him; I am doing well in the class, and it's horrible. Maybe it has to do with the class size, but there is a large disconnect with what he wants you to know and what you learn. He's a cool guy, just not a very good teacher

Need to read and listen to understand. NOT true that he just cares about Latinos. Yes his class is difficult because of the tricky questions. Just take the class as pass/no pass! Very rewarding in taking this class. Yes he only asks for one exam but you were warned here and by him. For the final he only have us one prompt. Overall, great class!

Such a disappointment. I came into the class having high expectations since so many friends recommended the course. His midterm was terrible, he made us write two essays and randomly picked one to make us turn in and told us to "keep the other one as a souvenir." Material was eye opening, however his method of teaching it was not effective.

Perla is a GREAT professor, very passionate about his work. I respect him a lot. The reason this quarter hasn't gone well for many of us is because while he is lecturing everyone is either on their phones or laptops ignoring him. It is no wonder why he has been going hard on us. Imagine standing there in front of 100s of students and being ignored.

Heard so many good things about this class so I decided to take it. For a GE, I found it to be difficult. The midterm is tricky, a bunch of true/false questions. My TA was a nightmare to say the least. Lectures were uninteresting. Awesome guy, okay professor.

Worst professor I've had yet. Tells you to write 2 midterm essays, only collects one (time that could have been used to study for multiple choice) and then tells the whole class he was going to make the final much harder because we did poorly on the midterm. Cares only for Latinos of the class, others are ignored.
Professor Perla is one of the most intelligent and inspiring professors that I have ever met. He is always in a good mood. Super approachable too. Love this guy! Must take him!

I was really excited about it at first, but by the end of the quarter I hated it. Lots of politics and lots of economics. He really expects a lot from you. Also, the midterm was ridiculous. Half the questions were T/F. Also, he told us we HAD to write two essaysâ€¦then only collected one, and we didn't get to choose which one we turned in.

very great professor, he seemed to be really enthusiastic about what he taught. I really loved his class because it exposed me to the Latin culture a little more. He often put humor in his lecture in order to keep students interested.

I don't know what happened, maybe it's the largeness of the class, but honestly one of the more uninteresting teachers I've had. Cool guy, bad teacher (his testing is horrible, makes you write two papers during midterm week, but you only turn in one).

Super easy class. Reading seem a lot, just need to get the gist. I'm Econ major so I loved learning the econ in his argument/opinion. Really opened my eyes to another view even though I don't completely agree w/ what he taught. Don't like his True/False questions on tests. Cool guest lectures and videos. May feel out of place if not Latino.

I loved this class and professor Perla.It opened my eyes to so many injustices in the world, and I would suggest it to anyone. Section is mandatory but the TA's are very kind graders and helpful with material. If you do the weekly readings, participate in section, and go to most lectures you should be able to get a good grade.

Took this class because of other people's comments about this class being easy. Readings aren't that dense and have to be up to date on them too.Tests can be rather tricky and the questions are phrase confusing at times. Attending section is not only mandatory but essential in getting a good grade in the class. TA's are somewhat lenient on grading.

The only reason I give this class a 4 in easiness is because I had a hard time understanding the Econ aspects towards the end of the quarter, but other than that, this class was great! Hector is such an inspiration and caught my attention greatly. He is so dedicated to the subject. Great experience!

I'm really grateful I took this class. I felt left out at times since I had to wait for someone to translate to me the lyrics of the songs, but Prof. always found a way to keep me coming back. Dammit prof! Seriously, one of the best classes I've ever taken. I learned a lot more in  just one quarter of LALS than history inAPUSHor APEuro.Thanks prof!

Professor Perla is an amazing person, he pushes his students to do great in his class. He is passionate for what he cares about, and even though he can be very strict, he is also very helpful and will not give up on you as long as you are willing to do the work :)

Awesome Prof! This class is easy if you attend lecture, which he keeps interesting. His use of guest speakers is great, and the book, while dense, aren't a bad read either. He's very caring and funny. No way you can't enjoy this class. Especially the clips.

He is a great professor! TA?s can be really strict though, but if you read ALL the readings you?ll be fine. I highly recommend you to take Intro to LALS! The midterms are so easy you just have to write your essays ahead of time.

Professor Perla is an awesome professor!! The class is very easy, as long as you attend lecture and discussion you should be fine. He really cares for his students and tries to dedicate as much time to them as he can.
Excellent professor and even greater human being. He reinforces the material on the readings by making it come to life with documentaries guest speakers and personal experiences. Great professor
Awesome professor! Highly intelligent and easy to approach!
awesome prof!! he makes class interesting and is pretty chill! a very approachable person and knows his material!!
He makes his lectures interesting and leaves you with a different view of the world when you leave class. Work is all graded by TA and they are very lenient.
HE IS AN AWESOME PERSON AND PROFESSOR!!!EXTREMELY INTELLIGENT, AND VERY HELPFUL..HE IS STRICT THOUGH!!!
He's pretty chill, knows what he's talking about, likes to crack jokes, fun at times, strict when needed.
